title: Shots fired at house in Midigama
byline: A shooting incident reported at Pathegama in Midigama this morning, according to the police.

title: Will Govt opt for private sector partnership for SriLankan Airlines?
byline: Partnership with the private sector is among the multiple options for the development of the state-run SriLankan Airlines but the government has not decided on any since its focus is now on the national carrier’s debt restructuring, Daily Mirror learns.

title: Six CID teams still pursue Deshabandu Tennakoon
byline: Six teams from the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) are still conducting their investigations to arrest the suspended Inspector General of Police, Deshbandu Tennakoon, who is evading arrest following a court order.

title: Sri Lanka’s industrial sector rebounds as economic conditions improve
byline: Sri Lanka is regaining its industrial strength, which weakened during and after the economic crisis in 2022, as reflected in the index that tracks industrial activity.

title: Sri Lanka’s tourism income hits US$768 mn in first two months of 2025
byline: Earnings from Sri Lanka’s tourism trade has continued to remain robust during the height of the seasonal peak as arrivals have been stronger. This is while the country is being recognised and featured by global publications as one of the most preferred destinations for travel in 2025.

title: Suspect arrested for sexual assault of flight attendants
byline: A 38-year-old man from Athurugiriya has been arrested on charges of sexually assaulting two flight attendants aboard a flight returning to Sri Lanka from Singapore.

title: Trump moves to close down Voice of America
byline: US President Donald Trump has signed an order to strip back federally funded news organisation Voice of America, accusing it of being ’’anti-Trump’’ and ’’radical’’.

title: Vatican releases first photo of Pope Francis in hospital
byline: Pope Francis was photographed at the hospital for the first time since he was admitted last month for double pneumonia.

title: 21 injured as bus crashes into house in Arachchikattuwa
byline: At least 21 individuals were injured when a passenger bus belonging to the Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) collided with a shop and a house in the Baththuluoya area of Arachchikattuwa this morning.

title: Sri Lanka needs Truth and Forgiving Commission: Minister
byline: Sri Lanka needs a Truth and Forgiving Commission while it has to be turned into a rainbow nation, Minister of Religeous Affairs and Buddha Sasana Sunil Senavi told Parliament today.

title: FitsAir to launch direct flights to Kuala Lumpur from April
byline: FitsAir, Sri Lanka’s first privately owned international airline will launch direct flights to Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, from 4 April, as part of its regional expansion strategy, the airline said in an announcement.

title: Foreign preachers sans proper documents removed from Sri Lanka
byline: Amidst a strict ruling by the Department of Immigration and Emigration (DIE) regarding foreign preachers entering Sri Lanka for prayer festivals sans relevant religious visas is in place, the authorities raided another congregation in Nuwara Eliya during the weekend and ordered two foreign pastors to leave the country with immediate effect, the Dailymirror learns.

title: ’’Catch me if you can’’
byline: Six teams from the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) are still conducting their investigations to arrest the suspended Inspector General of Police, Deshbandu Tennakoon, who is evading arrest following a court order.
